#include <iostream>
#include <cstdlib>
#include <string>

using namespace std;

void solve()
{
	int n,m;
	char ** ptr;
	
	scanf("\n%d %d",&n,&m);         // '\n' to delete the new line character that is left
	ptr = (char **) malloc (n * sizeof(char *));
	for(int i = 0; i < n; i++ ) ptr[i] = (char *) malloc (m * sizeof(char));

	/*
	for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
	{
		for(int j = 0; j < m; j++)
			printf("%c", ptr[i][j]);
		printf("\n");
	}*/

	for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
	{
		for(int j = 0; j < m; j++)
			scanf(" %c",& ptr[i][j]);    // Space because %c doesn't skip space so it will read 'n' as a character so here I am avoiding it
	}

	for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
	{
		for(int j = 0; j < m; j++)
			printf("%c", ptr[i][m-j-1]);
		printf("\n");
	}

	for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)	free(ptr[i]);
	free(ptr);
	return ;
	
}


int main() {
	// your code goes here
	int t;
	scanf("%d", &t);
	while(t--)
	{
		solve();
	}
	return 0;
}
